content.question: A force of magnitude <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math> is exerted on a block along a horizontal surface over a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math>, doing work <math alttext="W sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. The force is exerted at an angle of <math alttext="30 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mtext>°</mtext></math> above horizontal and there is negligible friction between the block and the surface. Another force of magnitude <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math> pushes an identical block along the same surface over a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math>, but the force is exerted at an angle of <math alttext="60 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>60</mn><mtext>°</mtext></math> above the horizontal. This second force does work <math alttext="W sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. What is the ratio <math alttext="W sub 1 to W sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="the ratio of the square root of 3, end root, to 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt><mo>:</mo><mn>1</mn></math>
<math alttext="the ratio of 1 to the square root of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mo>:</mo><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the ratio of the square root of 3, end root, to 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt><mo>:</mo><mn>1</mn></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
